flawed_nl_solution:
Jerry had 63 pieces of candy / 9 bags = <<63/9=7>>7 pieces of candy per bag.
There were chocolate hearts in 2 bags * 7 = <<2*7=14>>14 chocolate hearts.
There were chocolate kisses in 3 bags * 7 = <<3*7=12>>12 chocolate kisses.
There was a total of 12 + 14 chocolate candy = <<12+14=26>>26 chocolate.
Jerry started with 63 pieces - 26 chocolate = <<63-26=37>>37 pieces of non-chocolate candy.
#### 37

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 21, not 12. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
